meanings.sent1: The teacher was misclassing the students' test papers.
meanings.sent2: The librarian realized she was misclassing the books in the wrong section.
meanings.sent3: The robot kept misclassing the fruits as vegetables, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: The detective was misclassing the evidence, leading to a wrongful arrest.
meanings.sent5: Misclassing important documents can lead to serious consequences.

meanings.definition: The act of assigning to the wrong category or group.
meanings.sent1: The misclassing of the files caused chaos in the office.
meanings.sent2: She discovered the misclassing of the products in the inventory.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was the master of misclassing objects around the house.
meanings.sent4: The misclassing of animals in the zoo led to an amusing mix-up.
meanings.sent5: The misclassing of books in the library made finding them a treasure hunt.
